alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 9:53PM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Sturgeon River near Alston affecting Houghton and Baraga Counties. Michigamme River near Republic affecting Marquette County. Sturgeon River near Nahma Junction affecting Delta County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Michigamme River near Witch Lake affecting Dickinson and Marquette Counties. .Snowmelt and recent rainfall will continue to lead to high river flows and flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Michigamme River near Republic. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.8 feet, Water reaches the level from April of 2002 * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 11.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM EDT Tuesday was 11.8 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.4 feet on 04/08/1986. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Wednesday afternoon by 1 PM CDT /2 PM EDT/.
